intro: Steganthera laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered steganthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Steganthera laxiflora is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
